text: Lawrence (also called the Santa Fe Depot or the Santa Fe Station) is a train station in Lawrence, Kansas, United States. Amtrak's Southwest Chief train uses it. The Lawrence station was built in 1956 by the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway to replace the Atchison Topeka Santa Fe Station built in 1883. That station was damaged by the 1951 flood. It was dedicated on February 7, 1956. The Mid-century modern station is on the National Register of Historic Places. The station was added to the Register of Kansas Historic Places on November 18, 2017. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places on January 5, 2018. It was designed by Warren Jones and Warren Comen. ==References== ==Other websites== * Lawrence Amtrak Station (USA Rail Guide -- Train Web) * Depot Redux – Local group to preserve the station * Lawrence, Kansas Train Cam – A webcam facing the station from across 7th Street * Lawrence, KS (LRC) (Amtrak's Great American Stations) Category:Lawrence, Kansas Category:National Register of Historic Places in Douglas County, Kansas Category:Buildings and structures in Lawrence, Kansas Category:Railway stations in the United States
title: Lawrence station (Kansas)
